tit.cmt: タイトルなので説明訳括弧を削除しました。次行に補足しました。
新規統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 近的（きんてき）は、全日本弓道連盟弓道競技規則によって定められた、弓道競技種目の一種。
sen.e: Kinteki is one of the kyudo (Japanese art of archery) events established by the Rules of All Nippon Kyudo Federation.
Kinteki (the regular close-ranged shooting) is one of the kyudo (Japanese art of archery) events established by the Rules of All Nippon Kyudo Federation.
sen.cmt: 説明訳括弧を補足しました。
sen.e: Kinteki (the regular close-ranged shooting) is one of the kyudo (Japanese art of archery) events established by the Rules of All Nippon Kyudo Federation.
The diameter of the target is 36cm.
The diameter of the target is 36cm.
The diameter of the target is 36cm.

sen.j: 的中制と採点制がある。
sen.e: There are two methods of game, tekichu-sei (the accuracy system) and saiten-sei (the scoring system).
There are two methods of game, tekichu-sei (the accuracy system) and saiten-sei (the scoring system).
There are two methods of game, tekichu-sei (the accuracy system) and saiten-sei (the scoring system).

sen.j: 的中制の場合は霞的か星的を用い、採点制の場合は霞的を用いる。
sen.e: Kasumimato or Hoshimato is used for tekichu-sei games, and Kasumimato is used for saiten-sei games.

Kasumimato (the normal target for Japanese archery with three concentric circles) or Hoshimato (a target with only one black spot) is used for tekichu-sei games, and Kasumimato is used for saiten-sei games.
sen.cmt: 霞的の説明を補足しました。(the normal target for Japanese archery with three concentric circles)星的の説明を補足しました。(a target with only one black spot)[http://www.geocities.co.jp/Athlete/2074/terms/mean/target.html]
sen.e: Kasumimato (the normal target for Japanese archery with three concentric circles) or Hoshimato (a target with only one black spot) is used for tekichu-sei games, and Kasumimato is used for saiten-sei games.

sen.j: 現在の国民体育大会弓道競技は、的中制近的競技と、得点制遠的競技 (60m) の二種から成る。
sen.e: In today's National Sports Festival, there are two types of kyudo games, tekichu-sei kinteki and tokuten-sei enteki (the shooting for long distance on 60m).
In today's National Sports Festival, there are two types of kyudo games, tekichu-sei kinteki and tokuten-sei enteki (the shooting for long distance on 60m).
In today's National Sports Festival, there are two types of kyudo games, tekichu-sei kinteki and tokuten-sei enteki (the shooting for long distance on 60m).
